LEWI S
HILL
Duncans Mills, CaELf.
July 30, 195k
Dear Mr. Skornia:
I imagine you have received -word by this
time that the Rockefeller Foundation has made a
grant for the experimental project in poetry which
George Probst, Sy Siegel and I proposed under MSB
auspices. The grant is slightly under $10,000 for
an experiment of six-months duration. I am supposed
to begin the execution of this project at once, if
not so onerX — it was originally intended ty all
concerned to begin on July l£. In view cf the
slight delay I suggest that we take August 1 as
the starting point for the bookkeeping.
You doubtless have a copy of the memorandum
and Uidget on which the grant is based. I presume
disbursements will be made on vouchers over ny
signature directed to your office. If you will
advise me of your procedures in this respect I
shall be glad to commence the operation.
This matter has reminded me that I have
wanted for some time to take out an individual mem¬
bership in MSB. Gan you advise me of the procedure
for doing that?
Sincerely yours.
Mr. H. J. Skornia
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
Urbana, Illinois
